critique: This executive order aims to promote equality of treatment and opportunity in the armed services, regardless of race, color, religion, or national origin. This aligns with liberal values of social inclusion and equality. The order establishes a committee to examine and improve practices within the armed services to achieve this policy. It doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or economic regulation. The order promotes diversity and inclusion within the armed forces, reflecting a liberal stance on social issues. The creation of a committee and the directive for cooperation from federal departments suggest a moderate expansion of federal authority to enforce equality.
